bow: my little dude 10 months is starting to stand on his own how do help him learn to move his feet he just trust fall dives into me and scared he will do it when not paying attention and think going to catch him removed my only advice is do rush it he ll figure it out soon enough and omg he adorable good work mama don have any advice but just wanted to tell you that that is one adorable kid cutie my girl *finally* figured out how to move her feet and is cruising like crazy now at 12 months she was doing the same she just plant her feet and then let go and fall she eventually figured out that she could bend her knees to get back down and then started getting the confidence to lift her feet and move around did nothing other than try to prevent too serious of fall give him things that he can push around or help him gain his balance he is going to fall mama but that okay when he falls just stay neutral and help him up if he does do it himself kids are surprisingly sturdy at this age self correcting unfortunately bumps and bruises are normal once they learn to move around well on their own it wonderful that he trusts you to catch him when you re there and to comfort him whenever he inevitably hurts himself he is adorable think don rush it he will figure it out quickly maybe getting one of those activity walkers one with the locking wheels could be of some help to get him standing holding onto it and when he starts to take some steps he can walk with it thank you definitely do want to rush him but also do want him to face plant but guess it happens aw thank you so much am pretty obsessed with him he can bend his knees and sit on his butt thankfully so it not falling every time but yeah he definitely needs to gain the confidence too to start moving his feet he gets really excited and yells and closes his eyes and dives into me it is freaking adorable but just hope he does do it when not paying attention 🤦🏼‍♀️ ve read that kids learn to walk best when they are able to be barefoot lot it was counter intuitive to me because assumed shoes would give them stability but actually the opposite also he is precious ❤️ yeah him falling just breaks my heart ugh ll look into something he can push thanks yeah that kind of what figured just hate seeing him fall and hurt himself do love how much he trusts me he will close his eyes and like squeal and just fall into me so adorable but man hope he does do it one time when not looking and expect me to catch him thank you ll look into that did know there were ones with locking wheels he will figure it out on his own real quick in the meantime get fence around that pool asap https www poolsafely gov parents safety tips even if not in ca these guidelines are good idea https katchakid com california pool safety law much https www janetlansbury com 2011 03 reasons not to walk babies here good reason to use more hands off approach my daughter was learning to walk at 11 months which was right before summer she was great on her feet but as soon as we took her outside with shoes it was like learning to walk all over again because the shoes are so heavy on her little feet she is awesome in her sandals now she just has rough time maneuvering through the grass because the ground is so uneven was told also not to let her wear shoes until she learns not entirely sure why they are very spongey mine has faceplanted more often from his knee walking than when he on his feet just show him how to cruise along furniture for balance and eventually he ll figure out the motion he ll get there on his own bumps and bruises are part of the learning process do think my son went day without mark on his face from like months 14 he got the cruising down thankfully it his favorite was to get around think that will be how he walks he keeps almost letting go on the couch to grab onto other things he adorable he will figure it out unfortunately with lots of falls and missteps the more fun made the fall the better able my son learned to brush it off and try again lots of whee and kaboom they ll tell you if it really hurt them vs surprise it usually hurt my feelings more than it hurt him haha it sounds cruel but the best way for him to really learn is to fall and bump himself do make big fuss of him falling down when he does either again it sounds cruel know that but the best way for kids to learn is by trial and error obviously if he falls and it dangerous does freak out it slightly different but we assume here that he ll fall onto flooring at home source mama of two going through this for the second time out for sharp edges and stuff yeah we are in arizona so the ground is insanely hot and he squirms so much to get down so he can hold onto things and stand so we have to do shoes or we will have super pissed baby lol and that is interesting spoke to my pediatrician about it and she said as long as he is barefoot to learn at home then shoes wo hold him back any when we are out and about especially considering he wo be down on random floors much trying to walk it is just so hard seeing him fall just something ll have to get used to guess what cutie with all of my girls there was quite gap between them standing and walking like months once he feels more stable he ll just start going for it lose the shoes though it best for them to learn barefoot what remember reading is that without shoes on they are physically making contact with different surfaces and not only does that build lots of connections in the brain but also helps them learn how to shape their toes and learn how to balance on different types of surfaces try to make fun sounds when he falls but sometimes it will even scare me because most of the house is tile we have areas of the house that have thick softer rugs
